metadata.titel_preek: Second Sunday After Pentecost: Psalm 130 & 2 Corinthians 13

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God, whose inner nature is self-giving love, pursues and redeems humanity from a state of total inability and 'primordial catastrophe' through the Trinitarian movement of grace.

subject.identificatie: The Triune God (Father, Son, Holy Spirit)
tekstueel_bewijs: God pursues us even beyond the grave
The love that persists in breaking through our resistance
He shall redeem Israel from all his iniquities

object.identificatie: Redemption and Restoration of the 'Miserable Offender'
tekstueel_bewijs: to redeem his entire creation from its impulse toward self-destruction

zender.identificatie: The Trinitarian Nature of God (The 'Someone' who is eternal love)
tekstueel_bewijs: The inmost being of God is a dynamic interrelatedness that pours itself out
the church that was breaking his heart is the one that gets the full Trinitarian blessing
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is explicitly positioned as the Receiver (the one in the 'depths').

helper.identificatie: The Incarnation and the Holy Spirit
tekstueel_bewijs: love that has become incarnate in history through Jesus Christ
helper.rol_van_god: God is both Subject and Helper (Mediator).

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin as a 'Vast Primordial Catastrophe' and Human Resistance
tekstueel_bewijs: depths of human pride, disobedience, perversity
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described not as a mistake but as an ontological 'catastrophe' and 'estrangement' that renders the human subject totally unable to stand.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response of 'Fear of the Lord' and honesty/confession as an entrance into the larger life of God.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer / The 'Watchman'
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Honesty and Worship (The Fear of the Lord)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The human action (confession) is explicitly framed as a result of being 'enabled' by the discovery of God's prior forgiveness.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God pursues us even beyond the grave
God’s love spends itself to the very last drop
voorbeelden_mens_subject: the psalmist is enabled to raise up his eyes

voorbeelden: things which we ought to have done
straining forward to the approach of the dawn
knowledge that he and everyone else is a miserable offender
total inability to present ourselves righteous

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on human 'non-pouvoir' (inability) met by God's 'pouvoir' (resurrection power). Grace is the endowment of competence to the incompetent.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: The sermon moves from ~S2 (the modern denial of sin) to S2 (the depths/honesty) to S1 (forgiveness/grace).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in the 'Fear of the Lord' which paradoxically flows from S1 (Forgiveness).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; sin is treated as a cosmic catastrophe.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently maintains God as the active Subject of salvation while defining the human condition as one of total inability.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Potential Exemplarism in the parent analogy
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Imagine for a moment that you are the parent...

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God’s love spends itself to the very last drop

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Human parents/mentors are used as 'glimmers' or 'hints' of God, but the sermon explicitly states they are only small measures and often fail.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: Paul's desperation is a reflection of God's own 'foolish' pursuit of the lost.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and 'joyous liberating knowledge' through the removal of the burden of self-justification.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic leanings: Salvation is entirely God's work from start to finish.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the Trinitarian love (2 Cor) to the depths of sin (Ps 130) is logically linked by the concept of God's 'unrestrained' nature.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: God’s love spends itself to the very last drop of the blood of the Son.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is the 'fellowship' that enables the hearer to move out of 'petty record keeping'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a masterclass in theocentric narrative. God is the Subject of all transformative verbs.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is theologically intentional for a grace-oriented sermon.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon avoids the trap of 'exemplarism' by grounding human love in the prior, perfect love of the Trinity. It successfully follows Rutledge's rule.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'parent' pathos, Greimas shows that the parent is merely a 'Helper' actant pointing to the 'Subject' (God).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Moves beyond the meaning of 'De Profundis' to show how the text functions as a 'Subject-switch' from the self to God.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Fear of the Lord' is an actantial competence (Savoir/Pouvoir) granted by the Sender, not a work produced by the Subject.

appendices.notities: The sermon explicitly critiques the removal of 'miserable offenders' from the liturgy, which is a semiotic move to protect the 'Heavy Opponent' actant.
